definitions.text: a separate part of a whole
examples: an important piece of the evidence

definitions.text: an item that is an instance of some type
examples: he designed a new piece of equipment
she bought a lovely piece of china

definitions.text: a portion of a natural object
examples: they analyzed the river into three parts
he needed a piece of granite

definitions.text: a musical work that has been created
examples: the composition is written in four movements
it was a nice piece of work
he had a bit of good luck
he wrote an interesting piece on Iran
the children acted out a comic piece to amuse the guests
he wore his firearm in a shoulder holster

definitions.text: a serving that has been cut from a larger portion
examples: a piece of pie
a slice of bread
it is down the road a piece

definitions.text: a work of art of some artistic value
examples: this store sells only objets d'art
it is not known who created this piece

definitions.text: a period of indeterminate length (usually short) marked by some action or condition
examples: he was here for a little while
I need to rest for a piece
a spell of good weather
a patch of bad weather
a slice of the company's revenue

definitions.text: game equipment consisting of an object used in playing certain board games
examples: he taught me to set up the men on the chess board
he sacrificed a piece to get a strategic advantage

definitions.text: to join or unite the pieces of
examples: patch the skirt

definitions.text: create by putting components or members together
examples: She pieced a quilt
He tacked together some verses
They set up a committee
piece the broken pieces of thread, slivers, and rovings

definitions.text: eat intermittently; take small bites of
examples: He pieced at the sandwich all morning
She never eats a full meal--she just nibbles
She pieced the china cup
